name: add_project_module
description:
Create a new component in a Jira project.

This method creates a new component within a specified project. Components
are used to group issues within a project and can be assigned to specific
team members.

target_project_key.description:
The key of the project where the component will be created.
Must be a non-empty string.

component_name.description:
The name of the component.
Must be a non-empty string with a maximum length of 255 characters.

component_details.description:
A description of the component's purpose.
Maximum length is 1000 characters. None if not provided.

name: adjust_active_user_settings
description:
Update the current user's preferences.

This method updates the preferences of the current user.

theme.description: The theme of the current user

notifications.description: The notifications of the current user

name: batch_remove_tickets
description:
Delete multiple issues in bulk.

This method allows deleting multiple issues in a single operation.
The operation will continue even if some issues cannot be deleted.

ticket_id_list.description: A list of issue IDs to delete

name: check_active_user_privileges
description:
Get the current user's permissions.

This method returns the permissions of the current user from the database.
The permissions are returned as a list of permission keys that the user has access to.

context_project_key.description: The key of the project to check permissions for. Defaults to None.

context_issue_key.description: The key of the issue to check permissions for. Defaults to None.

name: check_search_index_rebuild_progress
description:
Get the current status of the reindex operation.

This method returns information about any ongoing reindex operation,
including whether it is currently running and its type.

name: define_new_ticket_variety
description:
Create a new issue type in Jira.

This method creates a new issue type with the specified name and description.
The issue type will be assigned a unique ID and stored in the system.

new_type_name.description: The name of the issue type. Cannot be empty.

new_type_details.description: The description of the issue type. Cannot be empty.

variety_classification.description:
The type of issue type to create (default is "standard").
Expected values are "standard" or "subtask". 
Any other value provided is treated as "standard" by the code.

name: delegate_ticket_to_person
description:
Assign an issue to a user.

This method assigns an issue to a specific user. The assignee can be
a user or can be set to null to unassign the issue (handled by how 'assignee' dict is populated).

ticket_id_for_assignment.description: The unique identifier of the issue to assign.

name: establish_new_user_collection
description:
Create a new group.

This method creates a new group with the specified name. The group
will initially have no members.

new_group_name.description: The name of the group to create.

name: establish_ticket_relationship
description:
Create a new issue link in Jira.

This method creates a new issue link between two issues. The link will be
assigned a unique ID and stored in the system. Both issues must exist in
the database for the link to be created successfully.

relationship_type.description: The type of issue link to create. Must be a non-empty string.

key.description: The key of the inward issue. Must be a non-empty string.
The key of the outward issue. Must be a non-empty string.

name: execute_batch_ticket_actions
description:
Perform bulk operations on multiple issues.

This method allows performing operations on multiple issues in a single
request. The operations are processed in the order they are provided.

ticket_modification_list.description: A dictionary containing the bulk operations to perform.

name: fetch_active_user_settings
description:
Get the current user's preferences.

This method returns the preferences of the current user.

name: fetch_file_attachment_details
description:
Get attachment metadata without file content.

Returns metadata information for an attachment.
This is useful for getting file information (name, size, type, etc.)

attachment_identifier.description:
The unique identifier of the attachment. Must be a positive 
integer or a string representation of a positive integer.

name: fetch_instance_details
description:
Get server information.

This method returns information about the server.

name: fetch_jql_auto_complete_data
description:
Get JQL autocomplete data.

This method returns JQL autocomplete data.

name: fetch_module_by_identifier
description:
Retrieve a component by its ID.

This method returns detailed information about a specific component
identified by its unique ID.

component_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the component to retrieve.

name: fetch_overview_panel_by_id
description:
Retrieve a specific dashboard by its ID.

This method returns detailed information about a specific dashboard
identified by its unique ID.

dashboard_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the dashboard to retrieve

name: fetch_project_classification_by_identifier
description:
Get a project category by id.

This method returns a project category by id.

category_identifier.description: The id of the project category

name: fetch_project_role_by_id
description:
Get a role by id.

This method returns a role by id.

name: fetch_release_by_identifier
description: Get a version by ID.

version_identifier.description: The ID of the version to get.

name: fetch_state_group_by_identifier
description:
Get a status category by id.

This method returns a status category by id.

status_category_id.description: The id of the status category

name: fetch_system_configuration_settings
description:
Retrieve application properties from Jira.

This method allows fetching either all application properties or a specific property
by its key. Application properties are system-wide settings that control various
aspects of Jira's behavior.

property_key.description:
The key of the specific property to retrieve. If not provided,
all application properties will be returned.

access_level_required.description:
The permission level required to access the property.
If not provided, all properties will be returned.

property_key_filter.description:
A filter to apply to the property keys. If not provided,
all properties will be returned.

name: fetch_ticket_creation_schemas
description:
Get the create metadata for projects and issue types.

This method returns metadata about projects and their available issue types
that can be used for creating new issues. The response can be filtered by
project keys and issue type names.

project_identifiers_filter.description:
Project keys to filter the results. 
If None, all projects are returned. This parameter accepts a 
comma-separated list of project keys. Specifying a project 
that does not exist is not an error, but it will not be in the results.

ticket_type_names_filter.description:
Issue type names to filter the results.
If None, all issue types are returned. This parameter accepts a 
comma-separated list of issue type names. Specifying an issue type 
that does not exist is not an error.

name: fetch_user_collection_by_name
description:
Retrieve a specific group by its name.

This method returns detailed information about a specific group
identified by its name. Groups in Jira are used to manage user permissions
and access control.

user_group_name.description: The name of the group to retrieve. Cannot be empty or whitespace-only.

name: fetch_workflow_state_by_identifier
description:
Get a status by id.

This method returns a status by id.

name: fetch_workspace_icons_by_key
description:
Get all avatars for a project.

Note: This returns all avatars with type 'project'

project_id_key.description: The key of the project. Must be a non-empty string.

name: find_confidentiality_tier_by_id
description:
Get a security level by id.

This method returns a security level by id.

security_level_id.description: The id of the security level

name: find_outcome_type_by_id
description:
Get a resolution by id.

This method returns a resolution by id.

resolution_identifier.description: The id of the resolution. Must be a non-empty string.

name: find_system_access_role_by_key
description:
Retrieve a specific application role by its key.

This method returns detailed information about a specific application role
identified by its unique key.

application_role_key.description: The unique identifier of the application role to retrieve

name: find_ticket_by_unique_id
description:
Retrieve a specific issue by its ID.

This method returns detailed information about a specific issue
identified by its unique ID, including any attachments associated with the issue.

ticket_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the issue to retrieve.

name: find_ticket_variety_by_id
description:
Retrieve a specific issue type by its ID.

This method returns detailed information about a specific issue type
identified by its unique ID.

ticket_type_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the issue type to retrieve. Must be a non-empty string.

name: find_tickets_for_selection_ui
description:
Search for issues based on a query string and/or JQL.

This method searches for issues based on a text query string and/or JQL (Jira Query Language).
The search is case-insensitive for text queries. JQL filtering is applied first, then text filtering.

search_term.description:
The text query string to search for in issue summaries and IDs.
If None, no text filtering will be applied.
An empty string "" will generally match all issues.

active_jql_filter.description:
JQL expression to filter issues before applying text search.
If provided, only issues matching the JQL will be considered.
Supports all standard JQL operators and functions.

name: find_urgency_level_by_id
description: Get a priority by id.

urgency_level_identifier.description: The id of the priority to get. Must be a non-empty string.

name: find_workspace_by_key
description:
Get a project by key.

This method retrieves a specific project using its key.

workspace_identifier.description: The key of the project. Cannot be empty.

name: get_all_system_parameters
description:
Get all settings.

This method returns all settings in the system.

name: get_all_ticket_varieties
description:
Retrieve all issue types from Jira.

This method returns a list of all issue types defined in the system.
Issue types are used to categorize and manage issues in Jira.

name: get_authorization_model_by_id
description:
Get a permission scheme by id.

This method returns a permission scheme by id.

auth_model_identifier.description: The id of the permission scheme to get

name: get_release_ticket_statistics
description: Get the related issue counts for a version.

release_identifier.description: The ID of the version to get the related issue counts for.

name: get_saved_search_by_id
description:
Retrieve a specific filter by its ID.

This method returns detailed information about a specific filter
identified by its unique ID.

saved_search_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the filter to retrieve

name: get_ticket_file_attachments
description:
List all attachments associated with an issue.

Retrieves metadata for all attachments that are currently associated with the
specified issue. The function automatically handles orphaned references by
skipping attachments that were deleted but still have references in the issue.
Returns an empty list if the issue has no attachments. The attachments are
returned in the order they appear in the issue's attachment list.

source_ticket_id_or_key.description:
The unique identifier or key of the issue to query.
Must be a non-empty string that exists in the database.

name: get_ticket_relationship_kind_by_id
description:
Retrieve a specific issue link type by its ID.

This method returns detailed information about a specific issue link type
identified by its unique ID.

link_kind_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the issue link type to retrieve

name: initialize_new_workspace
description:
Create a new project.

This method creates a new project with the given key and name.

project_identifier_key.description: The key of the project. Cannot be empty.

project_display_name.description: The name of the project. Cannot be empty.

project_manager_username.description: The name of the project lead. Must be a valid user name if provided.

name: initiate_search_index_rebuild
description:
Start a reindex operation in Jira.

This method initiates a reindex operation which rebuilds the search indexes in Jira.
The reindex can be performed in either FOREGROUND or BACKGROUND mode.

rebuild_mode.description:
The type of reindex to perform.
- "FOREGROUND": Reindex runs in the foreground, blocking other operations
- "BACKGROUND": Reindex runs in the background, allowing other operations
Defaults to "FOREGROUND".

name: list_all_authorization_models
description:
Get all permission schemes.

This method returns all permission schemes in the system.

name: list_all_confidentiality_tiers
description:
Get all security levels.

This method returns all security levels in the system.

name: list_all_event_listeners
description: Get all webhooks.

name: list_all_project_roles
description:
Get all roles.

This method returns all roles in the system.

name: list_all_system_access_roles
description:
Retrieve all application roles from Jira.

This method returns a list of all application roles defined in the system.
Application roles are used to control access to specific Jira features and functionality.

name: list_all_system_privileges
description:
Get all permissions.

This method returns all permissions in the system.
Not available in the real world API.

name: list_all_ticket_relationship_kinds
description:
Retrieve all issue link types from Jira.

This method returns a list of all issue link types defined in the system.
Issue link types are used to categorize and manage relationships between issues.

name: list_all_urgency_levels
description:
Get all priorities.

This method returns all priorities in the system.

name: list_workspace_modules_by_key
description:
Get all components for a project.

This method returns all components for a project.

name: modify_project_module_by_id
description:
Update an existing component.

This method allows updating the name and/or description of an existing
component. At least one of name or description must be provided.

module_id_to_update.description: The unique identifier of the component to update.

new_module_name.description: The new name for the component. Defaults to None and maximum length is 255 characters.

new_module_description.description:
The new description for the component
Maximum length is 1000 characters.
Defaults to None.

name: modify_saved_search_by_id
description:
Update an existing filter.

This method allows updating the name and/or JQL query of an existing
filter. At least one of name or jql must be provided.

search_filter_id.description: The unique identifier of the filter to update

new_filter_name.description: The new name for the filter. Defaults to None.

new_jql_query.description: The new JQL query for the filter. Defaults to None.

new_filter_description.description: Description of the filter. Defaults to None.

is_favorite.description: Whether the filter is a favorite. Defaults to None.

is_editable.description: Whether the filter is editable. Defaults to None.

name: modify_system_setting_by_identifier
description:
Update an application property in Jira.

This method allows modifying the value of an existing application property
or creating a new one if it doesn't exist.

property_identifier.description: The identifier of the property to update

new_property_value.description: The new value to set for the property

name: modify_ticket_details
description:
Update an existing issue.

This method allows updating the fields of an existing issue.
Only the provided fields will be updated.

ticket_id_to_update.description: The unique identifier of the issue to update.

status.description: The status of the issue. Example: (Open, Resolved, Closed, Completed, In Progress)

assignee.description: Assignee information in dictionary format. Example: {"name": "jdoe"}

due_date.description: The due date of the issue

comments.description: A list of comments to add to the issue.

updated_ticket_data.description:
The fields to update. Can include any valid
issue field. Expected structure if provided:

name: modify_user_collection_membership
description:
Update the members of an existing group.

This method allows updating the list of users in a specific group.
The group must exist before it can be updated.

target_group_name.description: The name of the group to update

user_list_to_update.description: List of usernames to add to the group

name: provision_new_account
description:
Create a new user with all required fields.

This function validates the input payload to ensure it contains the necessary
user details and that the email is not already in use. On success, it
populates a user object with a mix of provided data and sensible defaults.

name.description: The username for the new user. (Required)

displayName.description: The name to display in the UI. (Required)

id.description: The unique ID of the draft.

timestamp.description: The creation timestamp of the draft.

drafts.description:
A list of draft objects.
    - Each object is a dict with the keys:

id.description: The unique ID of the message.

messages.description:
A list of message objects.
    - Each object is a dict with the keys:

id.description: The unique ID of the thread.

messageIds.description: A list of message IDs in the thread.

threads.description:
A list of thread objects.
    - Each object is a dict with the keys:

history.description:
A list of history event objects.
    - Each object is a dict with the keys:

watch.description: A list of watched item IDs.

default.description: Whether this is the default alias.

sendAs.description:
A list of alias objects.
    - Each object is a dict with the keys:

user_creation_data.description: A dictionary containing the user's details.

name: query_tickets_with_jql
description: Search for issues based on JQL query.

jql_query_string.description:
The JQL query to search for issues.
Strings with spaces must be enclosed in single (') or double (") quotes.
Commonly searchable fields include:
- `id` / `key` (e.g., `id = "ISSUE-123"`)
- `project` (e.g., `project = "DEMO"`)
- `summary` (e.g., `summary ~ "critical bug"` or `summary = "Exact phrase"`)
- `description` (e.g., `description ~ "detailed steps"`)
- `priority` (e.g., `priority = "High"`)
- `assignee`:
    - The `assignee` field is stored as a dictionary with a `name` field (e.g., `{"name": "jdoe"}`), but can be queried directly using the username: `assignee = "jdoe"`.
    - The JQL parser automatically extracts the `name` field from the assignee dictionary for comparison.
    - The `name` field corresponds to the user's `name` field from the users table (not email or display name).
    - Dot notation queries (e.g., `assignee.name = "jdoe"`) are **NOT supported** by the current JQL parser.
- `created` (e.g., `created >= "2024-01-01"`)
- `issuetype` (e.g., `issuetype = "Bug"`)
- `status` (e.g., `status = "Open"`)

Supported operators:
- `=` (equals), `!=` (not equals)
- `~` (contains), `!~` (does not contain)
- `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=` (comparison operators for dates/numbers)
- `IN` (e.g., `priority IN ("High", "Critical")`)
- `NOT IN` (e.g., `status NOT IN ("Closed", "Done")`)
- `IS EMPTY`, `IS NOT EMPTY` (for null/empty checks)
- `IS NULL`, `IS NOT NULL` (aliases for empty checks)
- `EMPTY`, `NULL` (legacy empty checks)

Combining conditions:
- Use `AND` and `OR` for multiple conditions (e.g., `project = "WebApp" AND status = "Open" OR priority = "High"`).
- `AND` has higher precedence than `OR`.
- Parentheses `()` for explicit grouping of conditions are supported (e.g., `(project = "WebApp" OR project = "API") AND status = "Open"`).

Ordering results:
- Use `ORDER BY fieldName [ASC|DESC]` (e.g., `ORDER BY created DESC`).

The exact fields and operators supported depend on the JQL parsing and evaluation logic implemented in the simulation.

pagination_start_index.description: The index of the first issue to return. Defaults to 0.

results_limit.description: The maximum number of issues to return. Defaults to 50.

fields_to_return.description: A list of fields to return. Defaults to None (all fields).

fields_to_expand.description: A list of fields to expand. Defaults to None.

enable_query_validation.description: Whether to validate the JQL query. Defaults to True.

name: register_new_release
description: Create a new version.

scheduled_release_date.description: The release date of the version.

actual_release_date.description: The user release date of the version.

parent_project_id.description: The project ID of the version.

name: register_new_ticket
description:
Create a new issue in Jira.

This method creates a new issue with the specified fields. The issue will be
assigned a unique ID and stored in the system.

project.description: The project key the issue belongs to

summary.description: A brief description of the issue

description.description: A detailed description of the issue

status.description: The status of the issue. Example: (Open, Resolved, Closed, Completed, In Progress)

assignee.description: The user assigned to the issue in dictionary format. Example: {"name": "jdoe"}

issue_attributes.description: A dictionary containing the issue fields. Required fields include:

name: register_or_find_event_listeners
description: Create or get webhooks.

webhook_definitions.description: The webhooks to create or get.

name: remove_event_listeners_by_id
description: Delete webhooks.

webhook_identifiers.description: The IDs of the webhooks to delete.

name: remove_file_attachment
description:
Delete an attachment and remove all references from issues.

Permanently removes an attachment from the system, including the file data 
and all references to it from issues. This operation cannot be undone.
The function performs a complete cleanup by removing both the attachment 
record and all issue references to ensure data consistency.

attachment_id_to_delete.description:
The unique identifier of the attachment to delete.
Must be a positive integer or a string representation of a positive integer.

name: remove_module_by_identifier
description:
Delete a component from a project.

This method permanently removes a component from a project. Optionally,
issues assigned to the component can be moved to another component.

module_to_delete_id.description: The unique identifier of the component to delete

target_component_for_issues.description:
The ID of the component to move
existing issues to. If not provided, issues will remain
unassigned. Defaults to None.

name: remove_release_by_identifier
description: Delete a version.

version_to_delete_id.description: The ID of the version to delete.

new_fix_version_id.description: The ID of the version to move the fixed issues to, currently not used.

new_affected_version_id.description: The ID of the version to move the affected issues to, currently not used.

name: remove_ticket_by_identifier
description:
Delete an existing issue.

This method permanently removes an issue from the system.
Optionally, its subtasks can be deleted as well.

ticket_to_delete_id.description: The unique identifier of the issue to delete.

include_subtask_removal.description: Whether to delete subtasks. Defaults to False.

name: remove_user_by_login_or_key
description: Delete a user by username or key.

user_to_delete_name.description: The username of the user to delete.

user_to_delete_key.description: The key of the user to delete.

name: remove_user_collection_by_name
description:
Delete an existing group.

This method permanently removes a group from the system. All users
in the group will lose their group-based permissions.

group_name_to_delete.description: The name of the group to delete

name: remove_workspace_by_key
description:
Delete a project.

This method deletes a project.

name: resize_staged_profile_image
description:
Crop a temporary avatar in Jira.

This method allows cropping a temporary avatar to the desired dimensions
before making it permanent. This is typically used after uploading a
temporary avatar to adjust its appearance.

cropping_parameters.description: A dictionary containing the crop dimensions:

x.description: The x-coordinate of the top-left corner

y.description: The y-coordinate of the top-left corner

width.description: The width of the crop area

height.description: The height of the crop area

name: retrieve_all_outcome_types
description:
Get all resolutions.

This method returns all resolutions in the system.

name: retrieve_all_overview_panels
description:
Retrieve a list of dashboards from Jira.

This method returns a list of all dashboards in the system, with optional
pagination support. Dashboards are used to display various Jira data and
metrics in a customizable layout.

result_start_index.description:
The index of the first dashboard to return.
Defaults to 0.

max_items_to_return.description:
The maximum number of dashboards to return.
If not specified, all dashboards will be returned.

name: retrieve_all_process_flows
description: Get all workflows.

name: retrieve_all_project_classifications
description:
Get all project categories.

This method returns all project categories in the system.

name: retrieve_all_saved_searches
description:
Retrieve all filters from Jira.

This method returns a list of all filters in the system. Filters in Jira
are used to save and share search queries, allowing users to quickly
access commonly used issue searches.

name: retrieve_all_state_groups
description:
Get all status categories.

This method returns all status categories in the system.

name: retrieve_all_workflow_states
description:
Get all statuses.

This method returns all statuses in the system.

name: retrieve_all_workspaces
description:
Get all projects.

This method returns all projects in the system.

name: retrieve_attachment_binary_data
description:
Get attachment content as binary data.

Retrieves the raw binary content of an attachment without saving it to disk.
This function decodes the stored attachment data and returns it as binary content.
The content is returned as bytes that can be used directly by applications for processing, 
streaming, or further manipulation.

source_attachment_id.description:
The unique identifier of the attachment to retrieve.
Can be provided as an integer or string representation of the attachment ID.
Must be a positive integer that exists in the database.

name: retrieve_user_by_login_or_id
description:
Get a user by username or account_id(key).

This function retrieves a single user from the database. It prioritizes
the `account_id` if both identifiers are provided. If no user is found
matching the given criteria, it will raise a `UserNotFoundError`.

user_login.description: The username of the user to retrieve. This is deprecated.

user_account_id.description: The account ID (key) of the user to retrieve.

name: retrieve_user_profile_images
description: Get all avatars that are visible to the current user.

user_login_name.description: The username of the user to get avatars for.

name: save_attachment_to_disk
description:
Download attachment content to a local file in the current directory.

Downloads the specified attachment and saves it to the current directory using
the attachment's original filename. This function handles both binary and text 
attachments, automatically detecting the appropriate encoding and writing method 
based on the attachment's stored encoding format.

The function retrieves the attachment data directly from the database and
then processes it according to its encoding:
- Base64 encoded attachments are decoded and written as binary files
- Text attachments are written directly as UTF-8 text files

attachment_to_download_id.description:
The unique identifier of the attachment to download.
Can be provided as an integer or string representation of the attachment ID.
Must be a positive integer that exists in the database.

name: search_collections_for_selector
description:
Search for groups matching a query string.

This method searches for groups whose names contain the specified query string.
The search is case-insensitive and returns all matching group names. This is useful
for implementing group picker functionality in the UI.

search_phrase.description:
The search string to match against group names.
If None or not provided, all groups will be returned.
Must be a string if provided.

name: search_for_accounts
description:
Finds users by a string search against their name, display name, and email.

This function provides a general-purpose search for users and supports
pagination and filtering by active status. The search is case-insensitive.

query_string.description: The search string to match against user fields name, display name, and email

search_offset.description: The index of the first user to return. Defaults to 0.

result_count_limit.description:
The maximum number of users to return. Defaults to 50 (maximum allowed value is 1000). 
If you specify a value that is higher than 1000, your search results will be truncated.

fetch_active_users.description: If True, active users are included. Defaults to True.

fetch_inactive_users.description: If True, inactive users are included. Defaults to False.

name: stage_profile_image
description:
Upload a temporary avatar to Jira.

This method allows uploading a temporary avatar that can be used for preview
before making it permanent. Temporary avatars are typically used during the
avatar selection process.

temp_avatar_type.description:
The type of avatar being uploaded. Must be one of:
- "user": For user avatars
- "project": For project avatars
- "system": For system-wide avatars

temp_image_filename.description: The name of the file being uploaded

name: submit_profile_image
description:
Upload a new avatar to Jira.

This method allows uploading a new avatar image to be used in Jira.
The avatar can be used for users, projects, or other entities.

avatar_category.description:
The type of avatar being uploaded. Must be one of:
- "user": For user avatars
- "project": For project avatars
- "system": For system-wide avatars

image_file_name.description: The name of the file being uploaded

name: upload_file_to_ticket
description:
Add an attachment to an issue from a file path.

Creates a new attachment associated with the specified issue by reading
a file from the filesystem. Automatically handles MIME type detection,
file size validation, encoding, and checksum generation. The attachment
is stored in the database with full metadata and the issue is updated
to reference the new attachment.

target_ticket_id_or_key.description:
The unique identifier or key of the target issue.
Must be a non-empty string that exists in the database.

local_file_path.description:
Filesystem path to the file to attach. The file will
be read from disk and the filename will be extracted from the path.

name: verify_product_license
description:
Validate a license.

This method validates a license.
